title: Unit 9: Possibilities
grammarTopics: Modals for Possibility: May, Might, Could

theory.brief: May, might, could diễn tả khả năng (không chắc chắn). Have to diễn tả sự bắt buộc/cần thiết. Cấu trúc: may/might/could + base verb, have/has to + base verb. Don't have to = không cần thiết.
examples: If you practice, you could win the race. (possibility in conditional)

exercises.question: He __________ win the competition!
hints: Use may, might, or could for possibility

exercises.question: I __________ study art at a special art school next year.
hints: All three modals work for possibility

exercises.question: She __________ become a famous artist one day.
It __________ rain tomorrow.
They __________ not come to the party.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using may, might, or could
Rewrite using may, might, or could

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using may, might, or could
exercises.answer: They might come to the party.
acceptedAnswers: They might come to the party.
They might come to the party
They may come to the party.
They could come to the party.

exercises.question: We __________ go to school on Saturdays.
exercises.explanation: Not necessary, use don't have to
Modal verbs don't take -s in third person

exercises.title: Your future possibilities
exercises.instruction: Write a paragraph (6-8 sentences) about what might happen in your future. Use may, might, and could to talk about possibilities. Also include what you have to do to achieve your goals using have to. Think about: your career, where you might live, what you might study, what you have to do now.
exercises.example: Example: In the future, I might become a doctor. I could work in a big hospital. To achieve this, I have to study hard now...
